summary: The "Fixing Emergency Management for Americans Act of 2025" aims to reform and improve the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA). Key provisions include establishing FEMA as a cabinet-level independent agency, streamlining disaster assistance, reforming public and individual assistance programs, and enhancing mitigation efforts. The bill also addresses transparency and accountability, including GAO reviews and public dashboards. Specific areas of focus include improved aid to veterans, streamlining permitting processes, and addressing the backlog of open disaster declarations.
